title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit named Bilbo Baggins goes on a quest to help dwarves reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian society under the ever-watchful eye of Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The romantic clash between the opinionated Elizabeth and her proud beau, Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who leaves his prep school and goes underground in New York City for three days.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl named Scout Finch grows up in the racially charged Depression-era South where her father, a lawyer, defends a black man falsely accused of raping a white woman.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story of the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, led by Captain Ahab who is obsessed with the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society where people are genetically engineered and controlled by a powerful state.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
description: An orphaned young girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her mysterious employer, Mr. Rochester.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist named Victor Frankenstein creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.
